message:
I started a blog!
I am not sure what it will focus on, but my first article is a comparison of the different ways offered by C to address memory mapped hardware peripherals.

http://a3f.at/articles/register-syntax-sugar

Corrections and questions welcome, as are suggestions on writing style, the written or a topic I should write more about.
story: Ahmad Fatoum shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Syntactic sugarcoating for memory mapped registers « a3f.at
caption: a3f.at
description: Most instruction set architectures (ISAs) nowadays utilize memory mapped IO (MMIO). Some address ranges are decoded as being directed at IO devices instead o...
